Definition: Operator that evaluates the function name on the left-hand-side (LHS) of the opening parentheses using the arguments enclosed by the parentheses
Infix operator that assigns an object on the right-hand-side (RHS) to a name on the left-hand-side (LHS) -- this should be used for global assignments!
Infix operator that assigns an object on the right-hand-side (RHS) to a name on the left-hand-side (LHS) -- this should not be used for global assignments!
Infix operator that generates a regular sequence of adjacent values
Infix operator that extracts the values associated with a name (RHS) from a recursive object (LHS)
Infix relational operator (is equal to)
Infix relational operator (is not equal to)
Prefix logical operator (not)
Prefix logical operator (and)
Prefix logical operator (or)
Infix relational operator (greater than)
Infix relational operator (less than)
Infix relational operator (greater than or equal to)
Infix arithmetic operator (divide)
Combine values to form an atomic vector
A logical test of whether a value in a vector is [NA]
Return the highest value in a numeric vector (integer or double) as a one-value numeric or integer vector (depending on input)
Return the lowest value in a numeric vector (integer or double) as a one-value numeric or integer vector (depending on input)
Infix relational operator that tests whether the vector on the left-hand-side (LHS) is within the vector on the right
Attach the package environment for a given package to the current R session
Assign the items in a list to a specified environment
Remove a name from a specified environment (default is the global environment)
Subset an atomic vector to the unique values in the set
Sort the rows of a data frame by the values in a variable or variables
Subset a data frame by removing duplicate rows
Subset a data frame by logical condition
Extract a column from a data frame as a vector
Change the name assigned to a column in a data frame
Subset columns in a data frame by name (without quotes!)
Subset a data frame by row or rows using the row position(s)
Subset a data frame to the first row (default) or rows
Subset a data frame to the last row (default) or rows
Sort a data frame by a variable and subset to the rows associated with the lowest values of that variable
Sort a data frame by a variable and subset to the rows associated with the highest values of that variable
Extract the year from a properly formatted date value
The pipe operator passes the output of the LHS argument to the function on the right
Extract a list item from a list
Read an RDS file into R
Remove rows that contain NA values
Used in combination with select, this selects all but the specified columns.
Select a variable with a function that returns `TRUE` or `FALSE`
